about.description:
KaHIP is a family of graph partitioning programs.
It includes KaFFPa (Karlsruhe Fast Flow Partitioner),
which is a multilevel graph partitioning algorithm,
in its variants Strong, Eco and Fast,
KaFFPaE (KaFFPaEvolutionary) which is a parallel evolutionary algorithm
that uses KaFFPa to provide combine and mutation operations,
as well as KaBaPE which extends the evolutionary algorithm.
Moreover, specialized techniques are included to partition road networks (Buffoon),
to output a vertex separator from a given partition
as well as techniques geared towards the efficient partitioning of social networks.
about.summary: The graph partitioning framework KaHIP -- Karlsruhe High Quality Partitioning

name: kahip
raw_recipe:
# This file created by conda-build 3.24.0
# ------------------------------------------------

package:
  name: kahip
  version: '3.14'
source:
  patches:
    - 0001-install-python-component.patch
  sha256: 9da04f3b0ea53b50eae670d6014ff54c0df2cb40f6679b2f6a96840c1217f242
  url: https://github.com/KaHIP/KaHIP/archive/refs/tags/v3.14.tar.gz
build:
  force_use_keys:
    - python
  number: 4
  run_exports:
    - kahip >=3.14,<3.15.0a0
  script: bash ${RECIPE_DIR}/build-kahip.sh
  string: he074dcb_4
requirements:
  build:
    - _libgcc_mutex 0.1 conda_forge
    - _openmp_mutex 4.5 2_gnu
    - _sysroot_linux-ppc64le_curr_repodata_hack 4 h43410cf_13
    - binutils_impl_linux-ppc64le 2.40 hba8546e_0
    - binutils_linux-ppc64le 2.40 habd53a0_0
    - bzip2 1.0.8 h4e0d66e_4
    - c-ares 1.19.1 ha17a0cc_0
    - ca-certificates 2023.5.7 h0f6029e_0
    - cmake 3.26.4 h1403f77_0
    - expat 2.5.0 h883269e_1
    - gcc_impl_linux-ppc64le 12.3.0 h42a156f_0
    - gcc_linux-ppc64le 12.3.0 ha704aac_0
    - gxx_impl_linux-ppc64le 12.3.0 h42a156f_0
    - gxx_linux-ppc64le 12.3.0 heef3b40_0
    - kernel-headers_linux-ppc64le 3.10.0 h23d7e6c_13
    - keyutils 1.6.1 hb283c62_0
    - krb5 1.20.1 h5977a33_0
    - ld_impl_linux-ppc64le 2.40 hfa29eb9_0
    - libcurl 8.1.2 hdd5ecfa_0
    - libedit 3.1.20191231 h41a240f_2
    - libev 4.33 h6eb9509_1
    - libexpat 2.5.0 h883269e_1
    - libgcc-devel_linux-ppc64le 12.3.0 h7176aef_0
    - libgcc-ng 13.1.0 h39a4be8_0
    - libgomp 13.1.0 h39a4be8_0
    - libnghttp2 1.52.0 hb3a6636_0
    - libsanitizer 12.3.0 he912d23_0
    - libssh2 1.11.0 hb363fe5_0
    - libstdcxx-devel_linux-ppc64le 12.3.0 h7176aef_0
    - libstdcxx-ng 13.1.0 h09f375a_0
    - libuv 1.44.2 hb283c62_0
    - libzlib 1.2.13 ha17a0cc_5
    - make 4.3 hf817498_1
    - ncurses 6.4 h344580c_0
    - openssl 3.1.1 ha17a0cc_1
    - rhash 1.4.3 hb283c62_0
    - sysroot_linux-ppc64le 2.17 h23d7e6c_13
    - xz 5.2.6 hb283c62_0
    - zlib 1.2.13 ha17a0cc_5
    - zstd 1.5.2 h7affb48_6
  host:
    - _libgcc_mutex 0.1 conda_forge
    - _openmp_mutex 4.5 2_gnu
    - libgcc-ng 13.1.0 h39a4be8_0
    - libgfortran-ng 13.1.0 hfdc3801_0
    - libgfortran5 13.1.0 ha258ffd_0
    - libgomp 13.1.0 h39a4be8_0
    - libstdcxx-ng 13.1.0 h09f375a_0
    - libzlib 1.2.13 ha17a0cc_5
    - metis 5.1.0 hea85c5d_1006
    - mpi 1.0 openmpi
    - openmpi 4.1.5 hfa2ad77_101
    - zlib 1.2.13 ha17a0cc_5
  run:
    - _openmp_mutex >=4.5
    - libgcc-ng >=12
    - libstdcxx-ng >=12
    - metis >=5.1.0,<5.2.0a0
    - openmpi >=4.1.5,<5.0a0
test:
  commands:
    - test -f $PREFIX/lib/libkahip${SHLIB_EXT}
    - test -f $PREFIX/lib/libkahip_static${SHLIB_EXT}
    - kaffpa examples/delaunay_n15.graph --k 2 --preconfiguration=strong
  source_files:
    - examples
about:
  description: 'KaHIP is a family of graph partitioning programs.

    It includes KaFFPa (Karlsruhe Fast Flow Partitioner),

    which is a multilevel graph partitioning algorithm,

    in its variants Strong, Eco and Fast,

    KaFFPaE (KaFFPaEvolutionary) which is a parallel evolutionary algorithm

    that uses KaFFPa to provide combine and mutation operations,

    as well as KaBaPE which extends the evolutionary algorithm.

    Moreover, specialized techniques are included to partition road networks (Buffoon),

    to output a vertex separator from a given partition

    as well as techniques geared towards the efficient partitioning of social networks.

    '
  dev_url: https://github.com/KaHIP/KaHIP
  doc_url: https://kahip.github.io
  home: https://kahip.github.io
  license: MIT
  license_family: MIT
  license_file:
    - LICENSE
    - extern/argtable3-3.0.3/LICENSE
  summary: The graph partitioning framework KaHIP -- Karlsruhe High Quality Partitioning
extra:
  copy_test_source_files: true
  feedstock-name: kahip
  final: true
  recipe-maintainers:
    - minrk
